Reviews.Title: “Clean & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: SAM C
Reviews.Content: Great for the price, basic..... close to area attractions...... very clean......I have stayed in more expensive places that were dirty, ..... pool was nice and not crowded, it had some dirt in the bottom of one end but that was from the guests that day and it was cleaned the following morning. Did not like the first room assigned, room 101 next to the office, so we were moved to the second floor in the back facing the pool. Staff was very friendly, I would go back and stay next time I need basic accomodations in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: SameSame90
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Motel 6 during March 11-13. It was the only ones still available during spring break for a cheap price. If there were other places open we would have left but we were tired and didn't want to risk not being able to find another motel that still had vacant rooms. The first rooms given to us were #168 and #145. Both rooms smelled so bad, we had to ask for new ones or we were going to go somewhere else. Fortunately, we were able to change our room to a better one upstairs. The was no refrigerator and no microwave. The only good thing was that the beds were clean and the price was cheap. The staff was not very friendly except for the first guy who checked us in. While we stayed there, they would have people come in and give them those two rooms and everyone would come back out refusing them. There's tons of other hotels in Orlando that are only a couple of dollars more and much better but If you're looking for a cheap place and don't mind the smell, this might be the place you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “An actual case of getting what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Dave B
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 9 night for our Disney trip. We were there from March 8th-17th. I'll keep this short. The staff was very friendly, so I don't hold it against them. However, the rooms are small, even for an economy hotel. Heck, our bed was up against the a/c unit, literally. The room smelled like smoke for some reason and the worst part is that the room didn't even have an alarm clock. Yes, I'm serious, no alarm clock. Although the friendly staff was prompt with the wake up calls, we still have trouble sleeping without an alarm clock because we've had hotels forget wake up calls before.So I had to go buy an $8 alarm clock. It was a decent place to sleep and clean, but for a few bucks more you can go one light over to the Ramada and get a much better room. I've never seen a hotel room without an alarm clock...... Also, the walkways were narrow and felt tilted, as if they were going to collapse. We won't be going back and would suggest you pay a few bucks more for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long trip to Orlando with my daughter and we stayed at this Motel 6 for the entire week.I have nothing but praise for the facility and staff.The room was exceptionally clean and ALL of the staff were pleasant and helpful.This is not a Crown Plaza so don't expect anything more than the basics but it honestly cannot be beat for the price.We stayed for $24.14/night and I have to say I got more than my money's worth.At no time did I feel unsafe.It is in a great location close to numerous restaurants and gift shops.I would stay here again during a trip to the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap pays for bed bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canessnake
Reviews.Content: The stuff is friendly, specially the cleaning ladies. The rooms smell very bad, you can notice it even they use air fresheners. The mattress were so old, you feel being eaten by them. If that wasn't enough, we found lady bugs between the sheets!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not for me, or most for that matter.”
Reviews.Author: 16Traveler16
Reviews.Content: I was just looking for a clean, cheap place to stay for 2 nights while spending a day at Disney. I gave more weight to the reviews that were recently written by travelers with several reviews who said it was decent, but was sadly disappointed. I don't expect much from a Motel 6 and am usually happy with stays at their motels, but this particular motel fits the stereotype of bad Motel 6s. When I checked in, there was a policeman there talking to a guest at one of the rooms. Not a good sign, but every motel has had the police show up for some reason or another, so I let it go. Check-in was quick and my room was in the very back facing an apartment complex. The outside garbage cans were full with 3-4 bags piled up beside it (and it wasn't housekeeping's trash.) And the parking lot had obviously not been cleaned up in a while. My room had that typical musty smell that many Florida motels have. Hairs in the shower and a clipped nail on the telephone. Yuck, but the bed and linens were clean and I needed to meet my friends so I left. That night, the garbage was still piled up at the outside cans at the stairs. In the morning, there was no hot water for my shower. I was gone all day and when I returned around 5, there were two police cars at the motel! Police two days in a row - definitely a bad sign. My room had been "cleaned" - they had replaced the towels which I had neatly hung up but left the used washcloth in the bottom of the tub. And they obviously didn't vacuum. New garbage was now piled outside one of the garbage cans. I took a quick shower and headed back out. Later that night, the TV was out for a while due to heavy rain - guess that is pretty common with satellite TV. I told the employee at the counter about my complaints when I left, and she apologized profusely, but that was it. Although the police were there twice, I never felt unsafe and there seemed to be a lot of families at the motel. Had I more time to find another motel, I probably would have spent some more money to stay elsewhere. But at $28/night, it was too tempting to take the risk so I could spend my money elsewhere. That strategy usually works out, but was a big mistake this time.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, flithy, filthy”
Reviews.Author: SusieKH126
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night before my week long vacation at a Disney resort. The first thing my son said was "Are you kidding?" The parking lot was filthy, the rooms were so dirty that I bought a can of lysol and sprayed all the light switches, sinks, toilet, furniture and even the headboards. I told my kids to keep their shoes on the entire time we stayed there, the carpet was awfulI have never felt so grossed out in all my life. The room was 24.99 - and let me tell ya, you get what you pay for some times. Thankfully it was just for one night.

Reviews.Title: “29.99$”
Reviews.Author: mpdesjardins
Reviews.Content: All we wanted was a clean and safe place to sleep, shower in the morning and leave our stuff while visiting Disney. For 29.99$ a night, that's exactly what we got.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly ok in the past, but 2011 shi*hole of the year.”
Reviews.Author: Paramor
Reviews.Content: This place was the cheapest in kissimmee/orlando area and for good reason. For a couple who are fine with dingy Venezuelan or Mexican hostels this place was unacceptable. There were PUBIC HAIRS!!!! in the bed which was obviously not cleaned. There was food on the floor and the place smelled awful the moment we opened the door. For 7 dollars more a night we later stayed at best western lakeside, just down the road which had 2 pools and its own free minigolf with awesome budget accommodations. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, but clean & served our purposes”
Reviews.Author: TruthBeKnown
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Motel 6 Maingate West for one night on March 31st. As expected, we ended up rolling into town VERY late (i.e. around 2am), and all we needed was an inexpensive place to sleep for a few hours and take a shower. This motel fit the bill perfectly. The rate was just $30, and we had a clean room with two double beds. Despite the late hour, the front desk clerk was friendly and efficient. Our room was clean, the sheets were fresh, and the bathroom was well maintained. The rooms here are small and lack many of the amenities of more expensive properties, but if you just need a place to shower and sleep, this Motel 6 is a great deal. The exterior of the motel definitely needs some work, but we weren't there long enough to care! It's less than a mile from World Drive, so access to Walt Disney World is a snap if you have a vehicle. A couple of tips: there's no resort fee - hooray! There's also no shampoo in the rooms (BYO), but there is soap. Our A/C unit did a great job of cooling the room, but it was a bit noisy, so earplugs might be a good idea for you light sleepers. If all you need is a clean room with no frills for a great rate, I'd highly recommend this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff And Smelly Plus Dirty Pool”
Reviews.Author: blowinxbacks
Reviews.Content: I'm staying here right now and I must say the staff is rude. I told them that my deadbolt wasn't working so my door wasn't able to shut and all they did was basically tell me someone is coming over to fix it while three days passed by and noone ever came. On top of the fact that I'm 23, I'm not a disney fan so I bought a seven day pass from this girl valerie who was really nice and good looking so she made my stay happier :D but that was at the tourist info center. There is no free shuttle at this motel 6 so I had to sneak onto the free shuttle at ramada for a couple of days cause the Lynx bus takes about three buses and two hours to get to universal. There is bugs flies no shampoo just cheap soap and none of these people speak english. Its just like living in New York. This motel is just rude and the pool OMG there was a storm the day before and for a whole day there was no pool cleaning leaves from palm trees everywhere and the pool was dingy and small filled with stains on the bottom of the pool. I'm never staying here again. Maybe the one on international drive but not here. Its worth the extra twenty bucks a night for the ramada at least everyone is friendly and they had beautiful amentities. And lastly I did my laundry which wasn't free and I come to pick it up and its thrown from the dryer to a ledge mixed with some nasty girls panties bra and shorts UGH DO NOT STAY HERE UNLESS YOU ARE HOMELESS.

Reviews.Title: “Need's Alot of Work”
Reviews.Author: bgbeachbum
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the hotel in the morning then left for the day and came back that night. Noticed the door handle wasn't right pushed on the door and it opened right up. Housekkeping went to do room service and left do open. Hotel said sorry will look in to it. Had to care customer care to have issue fixed. Also the room I was in was full of flea's. They said the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right, but may not be enough to make us return.”
Reviews.Author: guavagirlKW
Reviews.Content: This place is inexpensive. We were just passing through and did not have great expectations. The rooms are extremely small and Spartan. The bathroom fan sounded like a jet taking off. The room wasn't dirty, but it was a little way from "clean", too. There were a lot of loud people wandering around outside although they quieted down by 11:00 PM. This motel is still much better than the Motel 6 EAST, but it is not as nice as it was a few years ago. We will be looking for another place when passing through this area. It is hard to beat the price as long as you keep your expectations low and are just looking for a safe place to sleep. I have seen much worse, but I guess I just want better. We were disappointed that they did not even offer internet access. Most Motel 6 will charge you $3, but it was not available here at all.

Reviews.Title: “Personal items thrown out by staff”
Reviews.Author: Bob84403
Reviews.Content: I returned to my room at this location one evening to find all of my personal things thrown out (with the exception of what was in the only drawer in the place, the nightstand), apparently by the housekeeping staff. I am patient, but I do have my limits. The manager did not show any interest in making things right the next morning, so I checked out and moved across the street to "Home Suite Home", phone --, which was nicer, less expensive, and far more professional, for the remainder of my stay. Later contact with the chain headquarters was also pointless. I have severed my loyalties to Motel 6.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all major theme parks, food venues and shops”
Reviews.Author: dreamsailing
Reviews.Content: The only thing I would criticise about this motel is that the sign for the hotel is set back a bit from the street and easily overlooked amongst all the other signs along the street. Aside from that the motel is good value for money, as the location is close to all major attractions, the staff is friendly and helpful and the room I had was clean and comfortable. Most certainly good value for money and someplace I would return to.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Alicia29Brandon
Reviews.Content: I used to work at Motel 6, and I must say this room I got was below standard to the other room I got three years ago from this motel while working for Motel 6. We paid thirty dollars for two people so I won't complain but this room definetly needed repairs. Discolored walls from water leaks in the bathroom roof, wood rotting at the bottom of the bathroom baseboards, the carpet was so dirty by kids had black feet after running around on it. Everything else was fine in the room. Please write off petty cash out of the cash register, and buy a couple new playpens for this motel. We didn't get much sleep at all because my two year old was running around the room the whole night making noises. We only had a crib at home, and we didn't have room in our car after packing all our things for a playpen. I have not had a problem with Motel6 not having a playpen in the past. The website said you had one but upon arrival we were upset to find out that you didn't. We were tired of driving, and decided to stay anyway but we couldn't wait to leave. Overall I would say if you don't want to spend alot of money in a hotel, and plan on going to Disney than this is the place for you. If you have young toddlers you probably won't get sleep here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, cheap, average... but”
Reviews.Author: TLACAELEL
Reviews.Content: Ok, lets start with location: LOCATION: Google Earth: Latitud: 28°20'3.97"N Longitud: 81°35'5.79"W 1. It is VERY near from all the Disney Parks, really near, about 6 minutes, eaven in a traffic jam. 2. There is a 7 eleven right around the corner 3. It´s on the 192, this avenue crosses almost all Kissimmee 4. If you follow the 192 to the WEST, you´ll find the 27, half a mile to the north there is a Walmart 24/7 5. There is a Dennys closeby 6. Lots of stores to do last minute shopping BUT DO NOT BE FOOLED: The prices of the gift stores are in most cases more expensive than the prices in the parks and the quality of the items are below. 7. The I-4 is about 7 miles away 8. The Premium Outlets its about 12 miles 9. The Universal Studios are a little far, but if you take the I-4 and then Universal Drive or the one on the back, you can make it in 18 minutes at the most. 10. No mayor Malls around the area just a Target over 192 West. GENERALS: • It´s cheap, I mean it´s a Motel 6. It cost me $182 (tax included) for 5 nights on holyday season. • It is not too clean but not too dirty. The only bad thing was that the room 136 had a smell of moisture combined with feet bad smell, not annoying but not comfy to live with. As we got there too tired to complaint, I went to the Walmart and got some odor killers and refresheners. Problem solved. • The bathroom was ok, a little not well washed but ok. • The bathtube had some moisture stain on it and my little son wanted to have a “swim”, so I bought some CLOROX. I bet no bacteria make it!!! • The swimming pool looked clean, crystal clear water and well attended, did not tested because the water was not heated and the weather was chilling. • The front desk personal always prompt and nice • The cleaning staff, always trying to clean the room as soon as possible, so they end his turn early, sometimes they knock the door until you open to say: NOT YET LADY! • One thing. DO NOT PUT TOGUETHER the beds. I needed a King, there is not one room with this, so I told the front desk guy If it was ok to joint both beds. I did, but the cleaning staff did not make the beds because they were together, they did them until I separated again. Not a big problem but there was a lack of communication there. • The cleaning staff does the rooms any other day. The pairs one day and the nones the other. • AC worked fine • Hot watter all time • Parking space always available but almost never close to our room. • The best places to stay are the rooms on front of the hotel or the ones on the East bound side. • Never had a problem of stolen or damage property • Never heard a thing from other guests • The Hotel is kind of hidden a few meters of the 192, that makes it kind of quiet and private.

Reviews.Title: “Still Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mbcParis
Reviews.Content: After staying there in 2007, I decided it was worth a try to come back while in the Orlando area. I'm still not disappointed with this motel; the front staff is very nice and I must say the maid went out of her way to answer every demand I had; I got plenty of towels every day ( even if I was traveling alone and not using all these towels ), the room was clean, so were the bathtub and the toilet. Really, when you're out all day, you don't need more; buy yourself nice toiletries if you want with the money you did not spend on a pricey room!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE place. will NEVER stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: annieb727
Reviews.Content: We checked in after a late night at Epcot. The lady at the front desk was nice and very helpful when we called trying to find it. She was equally nice at check in and check out. HOWEVER, the room was horribly kept. There were ZERO towels in the room. NO SOAP, and barely any toilet paper. There were four of us - me, my hubby and two little boys. Thankfully they didn't need toilet paper, but in six hours we ran out - and there was no extra roll. We did not use the tub, but there were pubic hairs in it - so if we had planned to use it, we would not have. Yuck! What was worse, was the smoke smell in the room. This was a non-smoking room with an ash tray. But we were all so exhausted we just went to sleep. We were checking out early in the morning anyway. I would never recommend staying here, nor would we stay there again. I'd rather pay $20 more and get a nice place on Priceline or something. Our rate was $29 for the night (with taxes) booked through their website.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, no frills, great value”
Reviews.Author: NamathTravels
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long weekend in O-town, spent lots of time at the parks, just needed a nice, clean, place to sleep. This was just great. Friendly staff, clean room, located close to Disney parks (5 minutes). Lots of restaurants, stores, and shops around. Room was small (just 2 beds, no table, chairs) but the bathroom was larger than most. This was a great place for the price. If you are a family on a budget and don't need a lot of room, stay here. Also, the pool was small but clean. Would definitely stay here agian.

Reviews.Title: “What's all the complaining about?”
Reviews.Author: rogue40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just last week. No problems at all. I don't understand what the negative comments are about. We had absolutely no problems in or with the room. The front desk people were helpful and friendly, even when the girl was by herself and doing three things at once, she still smiled and helped me with my change. The rooms are fine, and we never had to ask for anything extra that was not left (towels, etc). The rooms are not huge, but we did not go to Kissimmee to sit in the room all day did we? If you are wanting to sit in the room all day, by all means, do not stay here, but if you are going to use it as a base camp...sleep at night, leave in the morning, come back at about 6pm-8pm (like we did) it's more than fine. I guess some people are expecting mints and towel animals on the pillows. Oh yeah, it also helps if you do not have an attitude when dealing with the staff. Don't act like you are above all or you will have a reason to complain. I think too many people do not realize this.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place if you have your pet along”
Reviews.Author: midwestmommy
Reviews.Content: We drove to Florida and arrived a night early. Our Villa was not available, so we chose this motel for the night, as it was about the only place in town that was pet friendly and we had our tiny min pin with us. It was very clean and comfortable. No pet hair or signs of any pets from previous guests. No fancy amenities, so you plan to bring your own hairdryer, bath soap, extra towels and coffee maker. Otherwise no complaints. Nice location. You can walk to many shops and restaurants and it is maybe 5 minutes away from Disney. Good choice if your budget is tight or if you have a pet along. Nice clean, quiet place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DrivingMan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Motel 6 in Kissimmee for 4 days. I found it to be a very good and clean, budget motel. Would recommend this motel to others, however,with the following alerts: Rooms are very "small" and basic. Sink and tiolet were low, which I guess, would be good for children. Little room to move in the room with double beds, so not a good fit if you are going to spend a lot of time in your room with others. Room was clean. Also, Motel is a little noisey as Rt. 192 is right there and trucks pull in and out., try not to get a room facing the front street. Service at front desk was slow.. But, the plus's outweigh the above minus's. Cheap, Clean, ac worked, ice machine worked, clean carpets, bed was comfortable. Walking distance to restaurants and shops. Would recommend this motel to budget minded travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Super cheap, very clean”
Reviews.Author: someone_in_boca
Reviews.Content: Stayed Friday night 1/12/07 for $35. We decided to stay the night instead of driving home so we were desperately searching for available hotels late on Friday night. We checked in at 11:00 pm to a recently renovated non-smoking room (rm. 245). The walls were freshly painted and the new carpeting was the cleanest I ever had in Orlando. I've stayed in Orlando about twice a year for the last 10 years. This was by far the cleanest and was also the cheapest hotel that I've stayed. The motel seemed safe and quiet. There were many cars in the parking lot, but we hardly saw any people; just 1 woman walking her dog. This is in stark contract to the Motel 6 EAST Gate which had lots of freaks / druggies / scary people roaming around. We tried getting a room by the East Gate / Old Towne area but were scared off by all the noisy / drunk / unsavory type people. The West Gate area is much quieter and seems much safer. This West Gate area is just west of I-4 on hwy 192 (Irlo Bronson) . There were many hotels and restaurants in a few short blocks. There was a Perkins restaurant right in front of the motel and a Denny's, McDonalds, Shoneys, Ihop, Waffle House, Golden Corral, Bob Evans, and more just a block or two away. Pros: - super cheap ($35) - very clean - new paint and carpet (in room 245 anyway) - good breakfast places nearby - no bugs - quieter area (compared to EastGate and I-drive) - pool looked very clean Cons: - very small room (barely fits 2 double beds) - no shampoo, only 2 tiny bars of soap - sink and tub drained very, very slowly - it's a 2 story motel with outside walkways, not a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great-Until we found the bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Juboo16
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Motel for 2 weeks and everything was going great, the staff were nice (well most of them, one woman was quite rude), the loaction was great, right near Disney and a Golden Corral! Until we found a bug walking across the bed, I had read the other review so I knew it was a bed bug. As you can imagine I couldn't sleep and I found another 2 that night so in the morning we told the staff. They were really good and moved us 2 rooms up and we didn't see anymore bugs but after reading abut bed bugs it says they can easily spread from room to room so please bare this in mind before bookng your stay at this motel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Dec. 16-19 for a trip to Disney World. We found the room very clean & our service from the hotel was good. The front desk clerks were very nice to us. The only drawback to the room is that it's quite small but for the rate we paid, you really get your money's worth! It's very convenient to Disney too!! I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Bugs!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were awakened at 2:30 a.m. because we were being crawled on and bitten by bugs! The clerk when I checked out asked "Were they bed bugs?" I have never seen a bed bug before, but obviously they acted like they knew they had a problem. I've looked it up since then, and they look like bed bugs. She didn't refund our money for our less than 6 hour stay! Terrible problem with not only the room having BUGS, but also terrible customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Value, Value, Value. And dogone clean.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Gotta agree with other posters, this is the greatest hotel bargain I've ever encountered. Its located in the heart of tourist town, not far from Disney, etc. Tax, tag, title, out the door, I paid $28.32!!!!! I actually had a confirmed price of $34.19, but when I showed up, they said it was cheaper! It was quite clean other than the carpet perhaps being a bit warn. No hair dryer, no refrig, no iron or ironing board, no clock or radio. Although I didn't use it, the pool looked quite inviting. It sits back from the road a bit so there's no traffic noise. Be cautioned that there are two Motel 6's on this same stretch of highway, they're about 6 miles or so apart; I went to the first one I hit and they sent me to the other one, but would have put me up there and canceled the other reservation, but only had a smoking room. They may not have king beds, double check if this is important to you. I had two fulls. When her husband is out of town, I travel to Kissimmee to visit my girl friend, and will continue to take advantage of this great bargain when I do.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Corretje71
Reviews.Content: This place was a great place to be for us! It is a very cheap motel with a friendly staff and it is really nearby Disney!!! The motel was clean and there were a lot of restaurants and shops in the neighbourhood. Great. There are no big rooms and there is no fridge, but for that price it is a real good address to stay for a few nights. We stayed here for 5 nights. The most of the time we were in the Disney parks...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Check-in: Front Desk phone rang while I was checking-in. Front Desk Person answers it, and instead of putting the person on hold until I was fully checked in, she proceeded to take this person's full reservation for 10 minutes. Told me my room number, but gave me no directions on how to find the room. Room: Quite small, but very clean. TV was much smaller than the advertised 25". No real problems until the people in the next room entered. I could hear nearly every word they said through the connecting door...and it was closed. Area: Lots of restaurants nearby. Check-out: Quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel can be part of the Vacation too!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at motel six was exceptional, the service personell went beyond my expectations when my party arrived one day early and they arranged for a room to be ready that evening. The location was in the best interest of visiting the theme parks and tourist attractions. The price for the stay was a great deal, which I booked on line and saved a couple of more bucks. The room was clean and properly equiped throught our 10 day stay and I would definitelly stay at Motel 6 on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A real bargain!”
Reviews.Author: iowa50220
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this property several times. It has great rooms, friendly service and a great pool area. It,s only a couple of miles from Disney properties with lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance. It,s not the spartan accomodations you've experienced at other Motel 6 chain outlets. It's a real bargain!

HotelInfo.Name: Motel 6 Orlando Kissimmee Main Gate West
HotelInfo.Address: 7455 West Irlo Bronson Highway, I-4 at Exit #25-B, Kissimmee, FL 34747
